document_title: Stage 4 colon cancer: Signs and treatment
subsection_content:
According to the TNM system (Union for International Cancer Control UICC/AJCC 2017), stage 4 colon cancer is divided into two groups: (1)
Stage 4A colon cancer (any T, any N, M1a)
The cancer may or may not have grown through the colon wall (any tumor stage).; It may or may not have spread to nearby lymph nodes (any N).; Distant metastases in only one organ (M1a)
Stage 4B colon cancer (any T, any N, M1b)
The cancer may or may not have grown through the colon wall (any tumor stage).; It may or may not have spread to nearby lymph nodes (any N).; Metastasis from two organs/regions or metastasis to the peritoneum.
